lead_paragraph: Defending champion Barcelona will play Atlético Madrid in an all-Spanish quarterfinal, while Real Madrid is to face Germany’s Wolfsburg.

headline.print_headline: Chinese Firm Tied to Blatter Signs On as a FIFA Sponsor
headline.main: Favorites Kept Apart in Champions League Draw

snippet: Defending champion Barcelona will play Atlético Madrid in an all-Spanish quarterfinal, while Real Madrid is to face Germany’s Wolfsburg.
abstract: Soccer Roundup; FIFA agrees to four-tournament deal with Chinese conglomerate Wanda Group, first World Cup sponsor to sign on in more than two years; company subsidiary Wanda Sports Holding is helmed by Philippe Blatter, nephew of former FIFA president Sepp Blatter; other soccer news noted.
